pronunciation: MUNI'TION, [Latin munitio, from munio, to fortify.]

definitions.text:
1. Fortification.
2. Ammunition; whatever materials are used war defense, annoying an enemy. The word includes guns of all kinds, mortars, etc. and their loading.
3. Provisions of garrison fortress, ships of war, and general an army; stores of all kinds fort, an army navy.Munition-ships, ships which convey military and naval stores of any kind, and attend follow fleet supply ships of war.
